patientMessageList.name: Alex Johnson
patientMessageList.lastMessage: I've been feeling much better after starting the new medication

patientMessageList.name: Maria Garcia
patientMessageList.lastMessage: When should I complete the assessment questionnaire?

mockAssessments.name: Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9)
mockAssessments.description: A 9-question instrument used to screen, diagnose, monitor, and measure the severity of depression.

sections.name: Depression Screening
sections.description: Measures frequency of depressive symptoms over the past 2 weeks
questions: Little interest or pleasure in doing things?
Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much?
Feeling tired or having little energy?
Poor appetite or overeating?
Feeling bad about yourself or that you are a failure?
Trouble concentrating on things?
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed?
Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself?

mockAssessments.name: Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD-7)
mockAssessments.description: A 7-item instrument used to measure and monitor severity of generalized anxiety disorder.

sections.name: Anxiety Screening
sections.description: Measures frequency of anxiety symptoms over the past 2 weeks
questions: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge?
Not being able to stop or control worrying?
Worrying too much about different things?
Trouble relaxing?
Being so restless that it's hard to sit still?
Becoming easily annoyed or irritable?
Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen?

mockAssessments.name: PTSD Checklist for DSM-5 (PCL-5)
mockAssessments.description: A 20-item self-report measure that assesses the DSM-5 symptoms of PTSD.

sections.name: Intrusion Symptoms
questions: Repeated, disturbing, and unwanted memories of the stressful experience?
Repeated, disturbing dreams of the stressful experience?
Suddenly feeling or acting as if the stressful experience were happening again?
Feeling very upset when something reminded you of the stressful experience?
Having strong physical reactions when something reminded you of the stressful experience?

sections.name: Avoidance
sections.description: Assesses avoidance behaviors related to trauma
questions: Avoiding memories, thoughts, or feelings related to the stressful experience?
Avoiding external reminders of the stressful experience?

sections.name: Negative Alterations in Cognition and Mood
sections.description: Assesses negative changes in thoughts and feelings
questions: Trouble remembering important parts of the stressful experience?
Having strong negative beliefs about yourself, other people, or the world?
Blaming yourself or someone else for the stressful experience or what happened after it?
Having strong negative feelings such as fear, horror, anger, guilt, or shame?
Loss of interest in activities that you used to enjoy?
Feeling distant or cut off from other people?
Trouble experiencing positive feelings?

sections.name: Alterations in Arousal and Reactivity
sections.description: Assesses changes in arousal and reactivity
questions: Irritable behavior, angry outbursts, or acting aggressively?
Taking too many risks or doing things that could cause you harm?
Being 'super alert' or watchful or on guard?
Feeling jumpy or easily startled?
Having difficulty concentrating?
Trouble falling or staying asleep?

mockAssessments.name: Adult ADHD Self-Report Scale (ASRS)
mockAssessments.description: An 18-item symptom checklist designed to help screen for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder in adults.

sections.name: Part A - Inattention
questions: How often do you have trouble wrapping up the final details of a project, once the challenging parts have been done?
How often do you have difficulty getting things in order when you have to do a task that requires organization?
How often do you have problems remembering appointments or obligations?
When you have a task that requires a lot of thought, how often do you avoid or delay getting started?
How often do you fidget or squirm with your hands or feet when you have to sit down for a long time?
How often do you feel overly active and compelled to do things, like you were driven by a motor?

sections.name: Part B - Hyperactivity/Impulsivity
sections.description: Assesses symptoms of hyperactivity and impulsivity
questions: How often do you make careless mistakes when you have to work on a boring or difficult project?
How often do you have difficulty keeping your attention when doing boring or repetitive work?
How often do you have difficulty concentrating on what people say to you, even when they are speaking to you directly?
How often do you misplace or have difficulty finding things at home or at work?
How often are you distracted by activity or noise around you?
How often do you leave your seat in meetings or other situations in which you are expected to remain seated?

mockAssessments.name: Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test (AUDIT)
mockAssessments.description: A 10-item screening tool developed by the World Health Organization to assess alcohol consumption, drinking behaviors, and alcohol-related problems.

sections.name: Consumption
sections.description: Assesses frequency and quantity of alcohol consumption
questions: How often do you have a drink containing alcohol?
How many drinks containing alcohol do you have on a typical day when you are drinking?
How often do you have six or more drinks on one occasion?

sections.name: Dependence
sections.description: Assesses impaired control over drinking and increased salience of drinking
questions: How often during the last year have you found that you were not able to stop drinking once you had started?
How often during the last year have you failed to do what was normally expected from you because of drinking?
How often during the last year have you needed a first drink in the morning to get yourself going after a heavy drinking session?

sections.name: Alcohol-Related Problems
sections.description: Assesses harmful alcohol use and consequences of drinking
questions: How often during the last year have you had a feeling of guilt or remorse after drinking?
How often during the last year have you been unable to remember what happened the night before because you had been drinking?
Have you or someone else been injured as a result of your drinking?
Has a relative or friend or doctor or another health worker been concerned about your drinking or suggested you cut down?
